intro: Galium pseudoaristatum, commonly known as false aristothema, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a common sight in temperate regions of North America.
